intro: Wikstroemia forsteri, commonly known as the New Zealand sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and dry inland areas, often on rocky or sandy soils. It has small, narrow leaves and produces fruit that consists of a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds. Wikstroemia forsteri is valued for its ecological role and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental appeal.
